page.title: 07Social Concern:Health,School
page.content: Bus and train services are thought to be poor making it difficult to visit patients in Cuckfield and Crawley hospitals.Therefore improvements were wanted at the Queen Victoria Hospital for better maternity and old peoples' facilities,so that patients were nearer home.Improvements to the clinic and the need for a National Health Service Nursing Home for the elderly were also considered necessary. Legislation was wanted to restrict smoking in public and to punish dog owners who allowed their pets to foul public places.There was concern about the lack of discipline in schools and many said that they would prefer smaller comprehensive schools, or return to selection and the re-introduction of grammar schools. Many considered that all schools should have a nursery wing.
